lead_paragraph: The essential message of “Downton Abbey” is that the rich will always be with us, however bankrupt or indebted or criminally incompetent they may be.

headline.print_headline: The Stately Gift Shops of England
headline.main: The Stately Gift Shops of England

snippet: The essential message of “Downton Abbey” is that the rich will always be with us, however bankrupt or indebted or criminally incompetent they may be.
abstract: Op-Ed article by novelist Charles Lambert criticizes way even poorest English are made to feel stately homes of aristocracy are part of their heritage rather than symbols of class-based oppression; notes in particular that television series Downton Abbey appears to fully buy into this idea, even if it does wink at class disparity inherent in aristocratic system.
